ARABIC: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلْوَزْنَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا۟ ٱلْمِيزَانَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Give just weight - do not skimp in the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And observe correct measure, weigh with justice, and not cheat the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: but weigh things equitably and skimp not in the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Therefore, maintain just measure and do not transgress against the Balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And establish the measures justly, nor decrease the due weight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And observe the weight with equity and do not make the balance deficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And keep up the balance with equity and do not make the measure deficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and weigh with justice, and skimp not in the Balance.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Always measure with justice and do not give short measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And observe the weight with equity, and make not deficient the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Maintain the weights with justice, and do not shorten the balance!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And observe the weight with equity and do not make the balance deficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Give just weight and do not skimp the scales.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But maintain the weights with justice, and do not violate the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:9] And observe the weights with justice, fairly, and do not skimp the balance, [do not] decrease [the value of] what is being weighed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But observe the measure strictly) keep the balance of the scale justly; and it is also said that this means: observe your tongues by saying only the Truth, (nor fall short thereof) do not weigh less for the people such that you take away their rights.
